author: Jason Breslow
title: American journalist Evan Gershkovich to stand trial on espionage charges in Russia | WFAE 90.7 - Charlotte's NPR News Source
text: American journalist Evan Gershkovich to stand trial on espionage charges in Russia Updated June 13, 2024 at 14:58 PM ET Russian prosecutors announced on Thursday that they have finalized an indictment against jailed American journalist Evan Gershkovich, and said he will stand trial on espionage charges in the Russian city of Yekaterinburg, where he was arrested [more than a year ago](https://www.npr.org/2024/03/29/1241398745/evan-gershkovich-russia-prison-anniversary). Gershkovich, 32, was arrested while on a reporting trip for The Wall Street Journal in late March 2023 and is accused of spying for the United States. Gershkovich has vehemently denied the allegations against him ‚Äî as has the Journal ‚Äî and President Biden has called his detention " [totally illegal](https://www.wsj.com/video/biden-says-russias-detention-of-evan-gershkovich-totally-illegal/2196C001-5A71-41F9-B4DA-DE50C6D7ECC9)." The U.S. government has designated Gershkovich "wrongfully detained," meaning the government effectively considers him a political prisoner. Russian authorities allege that Gershkovich used covert methods to gather information about the Uralvagonzavod factory outside the Ural mountain town of Yekaterinburg ‚Äî a facility that has been [sanctioned by the West](https://sanctionssearch.ofac.treas.gov/Details.aspx?id=16885) and plays a significant role building tanks and other weapons for Russia in its war against Ukraine. In a statement posted to Telegram, Russia's Prosecutor General's office alleged that Gershkovich had "collected secret information" under "instructions from the CIA." But prosecutors have not publicly presented any information or evidence to support their claims, and at the time of his arrest, Gershkovich had been accredited to work in Russia by the country's foreign ministry. The top leadership of The Wall Street Journal responded to the announcement by Russian prosecutors by calling the allegations against Gershkovich "an assault on free press." "Evan Gershkovich is facing a false and baseless charge. Russia's latest move toward a sham trial is, while expected, deeply disappointing and still no less outrageous," said the paper's publisher, Almar Latour, and its editor-in-chief, Emma Tucker, in a statement. "The Russian regime's smearing of Evan is repugnant, disgusting and based on calculated and transparent lies. Journalism is not a crime," they added. The U.S. State Department also denounced the charges, with spokesman Matthew Miller telling reporters that Gershkovich "should be released immediately." "There is absolutely zero credibility to those charges," Miller said. "We have been clear from the start that Evan has done nothing wrong. He should have never been arrested in the first place." Prosecutors did not say when the proceedings against Gershkovich would begin, but once they do, he faces the prospect of a trial behind closed doors given that Russian officials say the case involves classified information. If found guilty, he could serve as much as 20 years in prison. Gershkovich is currently being held in pretrial detention at Lefortovo prison in Moscow, where according to the Journal he has been confined 23 hours a day to his cell, leaving only for meetings with his attorneys or U.S. embassy officials, and for occasional court appearances. Negotiating against the backdrop of war in Ukraine With his arrest last year, Gershkovich became the first American journalist to be detained by Russia on espionage charges since KGB operatives took the reporter [Nicholas Daniloff into custody in 1986](https://www.npr.org/2019/01/03/681851556/whelans-arrest-in-russia-draws-parallels-to-journalists-1986-arrest). At the time, the effort to free Daniloff meant having to navigate Cold War tensions between Washington and Moscow. Now, the effort to negotiate Gershkovich's freedom has been complicated by deepening friction between the U.S. and Russia in the aftermath Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Gershkovich is not the only American currently being held in Russia. Paul Whelan, a former U.S. Marine, is currently serving a 16-year sentence after being convicted of similar charges, and [Alsu Kurmasheva](https://www.npr.org/2023/10/19/1207197395/russia-charges-journalist-alsu-kurmasheva-radio-free-europe), a Russian American journalist with the U.S.-government funded Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty news service, is being detained on charges of failing to register as a "foreign agent." In recent years, the U.S. has agreed to several notable prisoner swaps with Russia. In 2022, the U.S. secured the [release of the U.S. Marine veteran Trevor Reed](https://www.npr.org/2022/04/27/1094988296/trevor-reed-russia-prisoner-exchange) in exchange for Konstantin Yaroshenko, a pilot sentenced to more than 20 years in prison for conspiring to import more than $100 million of cocaine into the country. Later that year, the U.S. released the convicted Russian arms-trafficker Viktor Bout [in exchange for the WNBA star Brittney Griner](https://www.npr.org/2022/12/08/1141503355/brittney-griner-freed). While families of detained Americans have cheered these exchanges, critics have said they incentivize Russia to take more Westerners prisoner in order to use as future bargaining chips. Addressing lawmakers on Capitol Hill on Thursday, the special presidential envoy for hostage affairs, Roger Carstens, told House lawmakers the announcement by Russian prosecutors was not unexpected. "I think we were all hopeful that we would be able to broker a deal with the Russians before this happened. But it doesn't stop or slow us down. We can keep continuing to pursue not only Evan's freedom, but also Paul Whelan's freedom as well," Carstens said in testimony to the House Foreign Affairs Committee. Copyright 2024 NPR

author: U24noticias
title: En Riad creen que Israel vs. Hezbollah en L√≠bano es inevitable
text: "La perspectiva de una guerra a gran escala entre Israel y la milicia libanesa Hezbollah aterroriza a la gente en ambos lados de la frontera, pero algunos la ven como una consecuencia inevitable de la guerra en curso de Israel contra Hamas en Gaza. Una guerra as√≠ podr√≠a ser la m√°s destructiva que cualquiera de las partes haya experimentado jam√°s. Israel y Hezbollah tienen lecciones de su √∫ltima guerra, en 2006, un conflicto de un mes que termin√≥ en empate. Tambi√©n han tenido 4 meses para prepararse para otra guerra, incluso cuando USA intenta evitar una ampliaci√≥n del conflicto." Esfuerzos de paz A continuaci√≥n presentamos un vistazo a la preparaci√≥n de cada lado, c√≥mo podr√≠a desarrollarse la guerra y qu√© se est√° haciendo para evitarla: La guerra de 2006, 6 a√±os despu√©s de que las fuerzas israel√≠es se retiraran del sur del L√≠bano, estall√≥ despu√©s de que Hezbollah capturara a 2 soldados israel√≠es y matara a varios m√°s en una incursi√≥n transfronteriza. Israel lanz√≥ una ofensiva a√©rea y terrestre a gran escala e impuso un bloqueo cuyo objetivo era liberar a los rehenes y destruir las capacidades militares de Hezbollah, misi√≥n que finalmente fracas√≥. Los bombardeos israel√≠es arrasaron grandes zonas del sur del L√≠bano y los suburbios del sur de Beirut. Hezbollah dispar√≥ miles de cohetes no guiados contra comunidades del norte de Israel. El conflicto mat√≥ a unos 1.200 libaneses, en su mayor√≠a civiles, y 160 israel√≠es, en su mayor√≠a soldados. Una resoluci√≥n de Naciones Unidas que puso fin a la guerra pidi√≥ la retirada de las fuerzas israel√≠es del L√≠bano y una zona desmilitarizada en el lado liban√©s de la frontera. A pesar del despliegue de fuerzas de paz de la ONU, Hezbollah contin√∫a operando en la zona fronteriza, mientras que el L√≠bano dice que Israel viola regularmente su espacio a√©reo y contin√∫a ocupando zonas de tierra libanesa. Videoclips fusionados de m√°s de 50 operaciones militares de m√°s de 760 operaciones en 100 d√≠as, llevadas a cabo por la Resistencia Isl√°mica. (Hezbollah) contra las posiciones del ej√©rcito de ocupaci√≥n israel√≠. La Guerra Una guerra entre Israel y Hezbol√° ‚Äúser√≠a un desastre total‚Äù, advirti√≥ el mes pasado el secretario general de la ONU, Antonio Guterres, en medio de una oleada de diplomacia itinerante por parte de Estados Unidos y Europa. Hezbollah, respaldado por Ir√°n, pareci√≥ tomado por sorpresa por el ataque de Ham√°s del 07/10 contra Israel, un aliado regional. Desde entonces, Hezbollah e Israel han intercambiado ataques transfronterizos diarios, intensificando gradualmente. Israel tambi√©n llev√≥ a cabo asesinatos selectivos de figuras de Hezbollah y Hamas en el L√≠bano. M√°s de 200 personas, en su mayor√≠a combatientes de Hezbollah pero tambi√©n m√°s de 20 civiles, han muerto del lado del L√≠bano y 18 del lado de Israel. Decenas de miles han sido desplazados en ambos lados. No hay perspectivas inmediatas para su regreso. Los l√≠deres pol√≠ticos y militares israel√≠es han advertido a Hezbollah que la guerra es cada vez m√°s probable a menos que los militantes se retiren de la frontera. El l√≠der de Hezbollah, Hassan Nasrallah, no ha amenazado con iniciar una guerra, pero advirti√≥ sobre una lucha ‚Äúsin l√≠mites‚Äù si Israel lo hace. Hezbollah dice que no aceptar√° un alto el fuego en la frontera entre Israel y el L√≠bano antes de que haya uno en Gaza y ha rechazado una propuesta estadounidense de trasladar sus fuerzas a varios kil√≥metros (millas) de la frontera, seg√∫n funcionarios libaneses. A pesar de la ret√≥rica, ninguna de las partes parece querer la guerra, dijo Andrea Tenenti, portavoz de la misi√≥n de paz de la ONU en el sur del L√≠bano. Sin embargo, "un error de c√°lculo podr√≠a desencadenar un conflicto m√°s amplio que ser√≠a muy dif√≠cil de controlar", afirm√≥. Preparativos Tanto Hezbollah como las Fuerzas de Defensa de Israel (FDI) han ampliado sus capacidades desde 2006, pero ambos pa√≠ses tambi√©n son m√°s fr√°giles. En el L√≠bano, 4 a√±os de crisis econ√≥mica han paralizado las instituciones p√∫blicas, incluido el ej√©rcito y la red el√©ctrica, y erosionado su sistema de salud. El pa√≠s alberga a m√°s de 1 mill√≥n de refugiados sirios. El L√≠bano adopt√≥ un plan de emergencia para un escenario de guerra a finales de octubre. Proyect√≥ el desplazamiento forzoso de 1 mill√≥n de libaneses durante 45 d√≠as. Unos 87.000 libaneses est√°n desplazados de la zona fronteriza. Si bien el gobierno depende de organizaciones internacionales para financiar la respuesta, muchos grupos que trabajan en el L√≠bano no pueden mantener los programas existentes. - La agencia de la ONU para los refugiados ha proporcionado suministros a refugios colectivos y ha entregado dinero en efectivo de emergencia a unas 400 familias en el sur del L√≠bano, dijo la portavoz Lisa Abou Khaled. La agencia no tiene fondos para apoyar a un gran n√∫mero de desplazados en caso de guerra, afirm√≥. - El grupo de ayuda M√©dicos Sin Fronteras dijo que ha almacenado unas 10 toneladas de suministros m√©dicos y combustible de respaldo para los generadores de los hospitales en las zonas con mayor probabilidad de verse afectadas por un conflicto cada vez mayor, en previsi√≥n de un bloqueo. La econom√≠a Israel est√° sintiendo tensi√≥n econ√≥mica y social por la guerra en Gaza, que se espera que cueste m√°s de US$ 60.000 millones, o alrededor del 10% de la actividad econ√≥mica nacional hasta finales de 2024, seg√∫n el Banco de Israel. Los costos aumentar√≠an dr√°sticamente si hay una guerra con el L√≠bano. ‚ÄúNadie quiere esta guerra, ni se la desea a nadie‚Äù, dijo Tal Beeri, del Centro de Investigaci√≥n y Educaci√≥n Alma, un grupo de expertos centrado en la seguridad del norte de Israel. Pero dijo que cree que un conflicto armado entre Israel y Hezbollah es inevitable, argumentando que las soluciones diplom√°ticas parecen poco probables y s√≥lo permitir√≠an que aumenten las amenazas estrat√©gicas de Hezbollah. Israel ha evacuado a 60.000 residentes de las ciudades m√°s cercanas a la frontera, donde no hay tiempo de advertencia para el lanzamiento de cohetes debido a la proximidad de los escuadrones de Hezbollah. En una guerra, no tendr√≠a sentido realizar evacuaciones adicionales, ya que los cohetes y misiles de la milicia pueden alcanzar todo Israel. Despu√©s del ataque del 07/10, la guerra en Gaza cont√≥ con un amplio apoyo interno, aunque ahora existe un creciente debate sobre su direcci√≥n. Alrededor de la mitad de los israel√≠es apoyar√≠a la guerra con Hezbollah como √∫ltimo recurso para restaurar la seguridad fronteriza, seg√∫n una encuesta reciente realizada por el grupo de expertos Israel Democracy Institute. En el L√≠bano, algunos han criticado a Hezbollah por exponer al pa√≠s a otra guerra potencialmente devastadora. Otros apoyan la entrada limitada del grupo en el conflicto y creen que el arsenal de Hezbollah disuadir√° a Israel de una escalada. Aproximadamente 500 casas en la Palestina ocupada fueron atacadas por Hezbollah en el norte, 80 de ellas recibieron impactos directos (a trav√©s del Ministerio de Defensa israel√≠). Hezbollah Una guerra a gran escala probablemente se extender√≠a a m√∫ltiples frentes, intensificando la participaci√≥n de representantes iran√≠es en Siria, Irak y Yemen, y tal vez incluso involucrar√≠a al propio Ir√°n. Tambi√©n podr√≠a arrastrar a USA, el aliado m√°s cercano de Israel, a una situaci√≥n m√°s profunda en el conflicto. USA ya ha enviado buques de guerra adicionales a la regi√≥n. Hezbollah tiene entre 150.000 y 200.000 cohetes y misiles de diversos alcances, dijo Orna Mizrahi, del grupo de expertos israel√≠ Instituto de Estudios de Seguridad Nacional. Este arsenal es al menos cinco veces mayor que el de Ham√°s y mucho m√°s preciso, afirm√≥. Los proyectiles guiados de la milicia podr√≠an alcanzar instalaciones de agua, electricidad o comunicaciones, as√≠ como zonas residenciales densamente pobladas. En el L√≠bano, los ataques a√©reos probablemente causar√≠an estragos en la infraestructura y potencialmente matar√≠an a miles de personas. Netanyahu ha amenazado con ‚Äúconvertir Beirut en Gaza‚Äù, donde la incursi√≥n a√©rea y terrestre de Israel ha causado una destrucci√≥n generalizada y ha matado a m√°s de 26.000 personas, seg√∫n el Ministerio de Salud de Gaza controlado por Ham√°s. Israel est√° mucho m√°s protegido, con varios sistemas de defensa a√©rea, incluido el C√∫pula de Hierro, que intercepta cohetes con una tasa de √©xito de aproximadamente el 90 por ciento. Pero puede verse abrumado si se lanza una andanada masiva de cohetes. Alrededor del 40% de la poblaci√≥n de Israel vive en casas m√°s nuevas con habitaciones privadas seguras fortificadas con protecci√≥n contra explosiones para resistir ataques con cohetes. Israel tambi√©n tiene una red de refugios antia√©reos, pero un informe del gobierno de 2020 dice que alrededor de 1/3 de los israel√≠es no tienen f√°cil acceso a ellos. El L√≠bano no tiene esa red, y los refugios ser√≠an de poca utilidad contra las masivas bombas "destructoras de b√∫nkeres" que Israel ha lanzado en Gaza. Hezbollah tiene defensas a√©reas limitadas, mientras que las del ej√©rcito liban√©s est√°n obsoletas e insuficientes debido a d√©ficits presupuestarios, dijo Dina Arakji, de la consultora de riesgos Control Risks, con sede en el Reino Unido. El ej√©rcito liban√©s ha permanecido al margen durante los √∫ltimos 4 meses. En 2006, entr√≥ en combate con una capacidad limitada, pero no est√° claro c√≥mo reaccionar√≠a en caso de una nueva guerra entre Israel y Hezbollah."

author: Telangana Today
title: Police complaint filed against two Karnataka nurses for conversion bid-Telangana Today
text:
Bengaluru: A police complaint was filed on Friday against two nurses by the Hindu Jagruthi Sene for attempting religious conversion in Kalaburagi district of Karnataka .
The incident was reported from the government-run Primary Health and Welfare Centre at Ratkal village in Kalagi taluk. The complaint was registered against Ashwini and Rubika, both nurses.
Also Read Miraculous escape for passengers as bus goes up in flames in Kerala The Hindu Jagruthi Sene has stated in the complaint that the accused nurses were offering money and converting people to Christianity. After getting a tip-off, the members of Sene went to the spot and questioned the nurses.
‚ÄúThey had invited religious preachers to the premises of the hospital and preached the Bible. The accused are indulging in religious conversion and creating communal unrest in the village.
‚ÄúBeing government staffers, instead of treating all patients without being bothered about their religion, the nurses were indulging in spreading propaganda against Hindu religion among the people in the hospital and indulging in religious conversion,‚Äù the complaint stated.
The Hindu Jagruti Sene members had intimated the police about the development when they questioned the nurses. The Ratkal police have registered the case.

author: Alyssa Mueller
title: Man who raped Independence mom sentenced 30 years in prison
text:
by: Alyssa Mueller
Posted: Jun 13, 2024 / 03:05 PM CDT
Updated: Jun 13, 2024 / 03:06 PM CDT
Brady Newman-Caddell is serving prison sentences in Kansas and Missouri for rape. (Kansas Department of Corrections) by: Alyssa Mueller
Posted: Jun 13, 2024 / 03:05 PM CDT
Updated: Jun 13, 2024 / 03:06 PM CDT
SHARE
KANSAS CITY, Mo. ‚Äî An Independence man already serving a prison sentence in Kansas for raping a Johnson County sheriff‚Äôs deputy pleaded guilty to one count of rape in Jackson County, Missouri.
Brady Newman-Caddell, 29, was sentenced to 30 years in the Missouri Department of Corrections for the 2016 rape of Taylor Hirth .
In 2019, Newman-Caddell was sentenced to 55 years in the Kansas Department of Corrections, the maximum possible punishment, for kidnapping and raping the sheriff‚Äôs deputy .
Investigation underway for how thieves accessed lockbox of Grandview home for sale Hirth testified about being raped by Newman-Caddell in February of 2016, eight months before the deputy was attacked. Newman-Caddell was charged with raping Hirth in December of 2016.
Hirth‚Äôs attack happened in front of her 2-year-old daughter when she and Newman-Caddell were neighbors in the same apartment building. William Luth was also sentenced in both rapes.
In 2019, Hirth addressed her vulnerability after the rape when she said she got the sense that investigators did not believe her nor take her case seriously. That‚Äôs until DNA from the rape of a Johnson County deputy linked Luth to her case.
Chiefs rally shooting victims continue to wait on ‚ÄòKC Strong‚Äô fund money In 2019, a judge said Newman-Caddell has psychopathic traits and she‚Äôs convinced he would attack women again if he was not locked away.

author: Newsroom Infobae
title: Orb√°n aplaude a Trump como el "presidente de la paz" y espera su retorno a la Casa Blanca - Infobae
text:
El primer ministro de Hungr√≠a, Viktor Orb√°n, ha aplaudido este viernes al ex presidente de Estados Unidos, Donald Trump, como el "presidente de la paz" durante el encuentro que los dos grandes aliados han mantenido este pasado viernes en la residencia del antiguo mandatario norteamericano en Mar-A-Lago (Florida).

 "El presidente Trum ha sido el presidente de la paz, se ha ganado el respeto del mundo y ha creado las condiciones para la paz", ha declarado Orb√°n a trav√©s de su portavoz, Zoltan Kovacs.

 "Durante su presidencia hab√≠a paz en Oriente Pr√≥ximo y paz en Ucrania. Si todav√≠a fuera presidente de Estados Unidos no habr√≠a guerra hoy", ha manifestado Orb√°n antes de reivindicar el cese de la violencia en todo el mundo. "Hemos coincidido en que habr√° paz cuando haya l√≠deres mundiales que busquen la paz. Me llena de orgullo que Hungr√≠a sea uno de esos pa√≠ses", ha dicho.

 Las conversaciones entre ambos tambi√©n tocaron las relaciones econ√≥micas donde, seg√∫n Orb√°n todav√≠a existe "mucho potencial" por encima de los 9.000 millones de d√≥lares generados por el intercambio comercial bilateral de la actualidad. "Pero no queremos detenernos ah√≠, y cuando el presidente (Trump) regrese (al poder) daremos un nuevo pulso a estas relaciones", ha a√±adido.

 Orb√°n se expres√≥ a trav√©s de su portavoz con el convencimiento de que el posible regreso de Trump al poder, siempre y cuando derrote al actual mandatario, Joe Biden, en las eleccione presidenciales de noviembre, es una noticia beneficiosa.

 "Ahora mismo, en Am√©rica, la campa√±a electoral funciona a toda m√°quina y va ganando velocidad. A los americanos les toca decidir y a nosotros, los h√∫ngaros, nos toca admitir, con toda sinceridad, que al mundo y a Hungr√≠a les ir√≠a mejor con el regreso de Donald Trump", ha ha concluido.

author: Ny MaGee
title: ‚ÄòBrick Lady‚Äô Roda Osman Turns Herself in to Police After Lying About Assault
text:
*The viral ‚ÄúBrick Lady‚Äù has turned herself in to police after being charged for allegedly lying about being attacked by a man after she refused to give her phone number to him.
We
reported earlier that Roda Osman, 33, used the incident to raise more than $42,000 on GoFundMe.
Osman went viral late last year after claiming a Black man cold-clocked her in the face with a brick. She was charged last week for fabricating parts of the story and profiting off her lies.
In a video shared online and posted on
 Instagram by the shade room, Osman (also known as Rho Bashe) can be heard saying, ‚ÄúY‚Äôall, this man just hit me in my face with a brick and all these Black men just watched. This man‚Ä¶grabbed a rock and hit me in my face because I wouldn‚Äôt give him my number.‚Äù
The video shows Osman yelling at the crowd of men and saying, ‚ÄúI want you to be a man and do something. You gonna let a man hit me in my face?‚Äù
View this post on Instagram
Osman is seen in a follow-up video
 wearing a hospital gown and her face swollen. She claims the crowd watched a brick hit her and let the man who assaulted her flee in a car. ‚ÄúHow is this OK?‚Äù she asked.
Her video garnered millions of views on social media, and she became known as the ‚ÄòBrick lady.‚Äô
During the investigation, police viewed the security cameras at the Houston club where Osman claims the assault occurred. Surveillance footage showed Osman and the man initially accused of hitting her with a brick getting into an argument. He appears to strike Osman in the face with a water bottle after she slapped him.
Roda Osman is an excellent case study of just how far a pathological liar will go to convince others they‚Äôre a victim when they made decisions they don‚Äôt want to take accountability for.
‚Äî üåç$IR G.B.$.üá∫üá∏ (@GRE8TBLACKSHARK)
[January 20, 2024]
As it turned out, Osman was familiar with the man before the physical confrontation, but she initially lied about the details of the assault to the police and the public.
Read about the investigation
here.
According to
Click2Houston, police charged Osman with felony theft by deception. She turned herself in on Tuesday.
An arraignment is scheduled for March 5.
READ MORE:
Viral TikToker Who Claimed Black Man Attacked Her with Brick Charged for Lying About Incident
